content.question: Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is best modeled by a linear function, because the average rate of change over any length input-value interval is constant.
<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals are constant.

<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is best modeled by a linear function, because the successive <math alttext="second"><mn>2</mn><mtext>nd</mtext></math> differences of the output values over equal-interval input values are constant.

<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the successive <math alttext="second"><mn>2</mn><mtext>nd</mtext></math> differences of the output values over equal-interval input values are constant.

content.answer: <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the successive <math alttext="second"><mn>2</mn><mtext>nd</mtext></math> differences of the output values over equal-interval input values are constant.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
